title: By Adverse Winds. [A novel.]
author: Smeaton, William Henry Oliphant.
snippet: Through this medium, the happy possessor could see all that was transpiring at the moment on any spot of the globe he chose. Through the pantiscope of the novelist, in like manner, I would ask the reader, wheresoever he be, to observe, in the highway termed Grange Loan, but standing well back from the lodge-gates, within spacious and wooded grounds, a certain large, oldfashioned, whitewashed family mansion. Ramblingly irregular was it in every part, with its quaint crow-stepped gables and corner turrets, its clustered chimneys and long narrow windows heavily mullioned and " transomed," all betokening the hybrid style of architecture prevalent in Scotland when last century was in its teens.
